availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry H. Brooks (Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Louisa Brooks. Father of John Brooks, Stephen Brooks, Wiley Brooks, Roan Brooks, Joanna Brooks, Nancy Brooks, Virginia Brooks, and Sarah C. Brooks. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 136B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 729.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 603-04.
"Henry Herbert Brooks (1818-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #42958082, accessed December 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42958082.
